website_summaries.verdict: A heavy-duty, four-sided target that handily stops arrows, then lets you easily remove them by hand.
pros: Stops arrows with ease, and they can easily be removed by hand
Designed for high speed crossbow, compound bow and airbow
Easy arrow removal.Tote handles for easy portability
For use with field points only for longer target life
cons: Cannot use broadheads with this target

customer_reviews.title: Great target at a great price
customer_reviews.text: This target works great for my Excalibur axiom and crossbow which shoots 305 fps. I've included a picture of this target being shot 4 times from 40 yards. As you can see, it easily stops the arrows safely and I can remove them with only two fingers. I have been shooting at the deer side of this target for quit a while now and I haven't noticed any significant wear. Still stops the arrows great. I think it's the best bang for the buck target out there.
customer_reviews.author: jeremy spilm

customer_reviews.title: 400 FPS or more fletchings get ruined
customer_reviews.text: My bow shoots about 405 fps. 405 again, not 450. And every other shot from 20 yards has ruined my fletchings. It’s a great target for my bows under 400 FPS but not holding up to the advertisement. Great target and great price, I’m simply giving it a 1 Star bc it doesn’t perform as advertised. I understand it may be impossible to have a target that would hold out 450 FPS while also being easy enough for you to just pull your bolt or arrow out, but I’m not the one who claimed it does it.
customer_reviews.author: Walker1212

customer_reviews.title: If your on the fence s*** or get off the pot. This target is great
customer_reviews.text: To be honest I was skeptical of this target due to it being half the price of the rhino block. But between me the wife and a few buddies and a few beers we have probably shot around 500 arrows at it over the weekend. I shoot a mathews with a 70 lb draw. And at 20 yards my arrows can be removed by my 4 year daughter. The color choices on the target could be better but hey I've got some fluorescent orange paint laying around when I get to mad at the colors morrel used I can always spray a orange dot. I would recommend this to anyone wanting to shoot or tune their bows at home.
customer_reviews.author: doug

customer_reviews.title: Arrows so stuck resulting in injury.
customer_reviews.text: Not easy arrow removal, arrows get so stuck shooting a Hoyt helix, I’m talking one foot on the bag two hands on the arrow stuck and getting stabbed in the jaw with the end of the arrow when it finally releases stuck. Happy it wasn’t my eye. weird fishing line like material inside gets bound around the arrows and impossible to get out, even with two people pulling. Getting a foam based target instead.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremiah Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Won't Stop Ravin Crossbow Bolts As Claimed!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this target after reading reviews saying the target would stop Ravin bolts. It does not do use very well. Claims to work for crossbows up to 450 fps. My R20 bolt will stop once in a given location, but not twice. In other words, its good for one hit per location. If you fire two shots at small/similar spot, the bolt is buried or blows through target. The Ravin R20 claims to shoot 435 fps. My chronograph measured it slightly lower. A target rated for 450 fps should work, but it does NOT. If you shoot a high speed crossbow, don't expect this one to work.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Stops 370 fps crossbow bolts.
customer_reviews.text: Heavy. It does not move. You can carry it but it takes 2 hands. Stops my bolts at about half way. Easy to remove. On my other targets I need an arrow puller. I like the game images but would like to have 1 side with 1 inch squares for scope adjustments. I don't think it will hold up that well over time only shooting it a dozen times the holes are plain to see where as my other targets have 100+ arrows in them and still look and work fine. The performance is good and it is not too expensive. If it wears out I will buy same brand again.
customer_reviews.author: J. S

customer_reviews.title: FANTASTIC PRODUCT!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Everyone knows Morrell makes the best bag targets there is hands down and this is probably the best bag type target to date I have ever purchased besides a "Supreme 3" & Cam Hanes big bag both of which are Morrells as well. I live in FL and leave a lot of targets out in the back yard because I shoot about 100 arrows a day and do not want to keep loading and unloading out of my garage and after 2 months this target its holding up great.
customer_reviews.author: David Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Good sturdy target, multiple targets on the different sides, and you don't need a target stand to use it.
customer_reviews.text: My kids wanted to get something for my husband's "bow and arrow" this past Christmas. I suggested a target, figuring that would be (almost) in their combined price range. We settled on this one after reading all the reviews. What sold me in particular? - durability and sturdiness - ease of removing arrows with target-shooting tips - multi-sided target feature - weight of the target, you don't need a stand (it's a cube, so it won't fall over at point of impact) - price - it's a good size! I'll post an update if there are any changes once we've actually gotten this out for target practice, but based on the positive (and thorough) reviews, I anticipate no changes.
customer_reviews.author: Betsy Finn

customer_reviews.title: Great crossbow target !!
customer_reviews.text: This target stops my FMJ crossbow bolts like nothing. I also shoot hypodermics and although I would use one of the broad heads. The practice tip did very minimal damage. I would think you could get away with a few broad head shots with minor damage. Like one or two shots a year maybe to make sure your zero'd in. The bolts come out like butter. No veins popping out of your neck trying to get your arrow back. I really have no complaints. It's exactly what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Honest Adventurer

customer_reviews.title: Good target for crossbows
customer_reviews.text: I shoot a TenPoint crossbow and this target is able to withstand numerous shots and from that stand point if very durable. Unfortunately, the handles that are used to move the target didn't last a month. One handle broke the first time I moved the target after unpacking. The second handle broke about a month later. I live in an area where I don't trust the target sitting out and move it frequently in and out of my garage so the broken handles are a bummer, but not a deal breaker. Good target, poor handles.
customer_reviews.author: Muppert

customer_reviews.title: Works for 415fps crossbow
customer_reviews.text: Just got my first crossbow and was concerned that it would shoot through this target. However, this target is holding up well so far. Even at 10yards arrows stick in about 12". If you keep shooting in 1 spot the arrows will sink further, but that is to be expected. Still sighting in the bow and then I will target different points. staples on bottom might scratch up a floor, handles seem strong enough for now. It isn't too heavy for me, but I wouldn't want to haul it everywhere. shooting a KI Ripper 415
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: As advertised!
customer_reviews.text: I shoot a crossbow that chronographs in at 428fps average velocity. This target works great! 100gr target points, 400gr total arrow weight (my crossbow uses nocked "arrows" not bolts) and the target catches them each and every time. This holds true even on the high impact zones around each point-of-aim. Easy arrow removal, even without any arrow grease! Bag has two handles for carry and so far has stood up to my harsh treatment. Yes, I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: 11B40PX2S

customer_reviews.title: Best crossbow target I've ever used
customer_reviews.text: Finally got a good target! Can't tell you how many cheap or poor quality targets that claim 300-400 fps but after a week your bolts go right through the target. Not this bad boy; used this to dial in a few new scopes and play a few games. Put a few hundred bolts into this target already and it hasn't faltered yet. I do cover it up when not using it; the sun was starting to fade it. Really good target.
customer_reviews.author: BloodAgentTop Contributor: Star Wars

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied......
customer_reviews.text: Pleased to receive this. Finally, I can zero my crossbow without burying my bolts/arrows beyond the fletching. I have a top of the line 360 FPS crossbow. My 20” bolts penetrate only half way and are literally removable with just a two finger pull. The outer cover does seem to take a bit of damage from each shot. Will have to see how it holds up over time.
customer_reviews.author: J LAN

customer_reviews.title: Great target!
customer_reviews.text: I’m not one to write many reviews, but this target surprised me. Coming from a cheap foam target to this was a dream. The target is heavier than I expected, but the weight keeps it from dancing around on you. Two finger arrow removal is no problem with this target. Whether you’re at 60 yards or ten, I haven’t experienced more than about 6 inches of penetration. (Chuckle) After approximately 250 arrows in, the target is holding up nicely. Sure, you can tell it’s been shot, but the graphics and bullseyes are still very well in tact. I’m not afraid to say I believe I’ll get thousands of arrows out of this target.
customer_reviews.author: Hunter F.

customer_reviews.title: Good Target for the right arrows
customer_reviews.text: This is an overall great target with standard inserts / field point. My daughter shot the hell out of it for a few years with no issue and definitely got our moneys worth. But once I switched to the small diameter arrows with the stainless steel outserts, they just tore the target up and was super difficult to remove. Not the targets fault, just not designed for those type arrows like a layered target is. But that said, again a great overall target.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great target
customer_reviews.text: This thing will stop a 400+ crossbow with easy pull out. I bought a new ravin and it was sinking the bolts past the fletching in my block. This stopped them half way in and pulled out easy
customer_reviews.author: Bobby Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Great Target - buy this
customer_reviews.text: Great target - hold up well and stops arrows fast. - I am shooting a 40lb recurve so my FPS isnt huge, but it stopes my practice arrow in a few inches (sometimes the arrows dont sink very far and fall back out), my buddy is shooting with a 60lb compound and his arrows sink just further then mine. arrows come out easy with out arrow puller. definitly going to last a long time. I would have to replace the outside cover from arrow holes long before I replaced it for foam damage. to date I have shot about 500 arrows into this target between 2 sides.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Good product. A bit heavy, but that is the nature of the beast so to speak. I would definatly recommend this product. I have not used broadheads on it so i cant speak to the durability with them. I have only used bullet tip field points and they are a little difficult to get out due to the shape of the design. I am using a 10 plus year old Mathews solocam set at 60lbs with approximately just over 400 grain arrows with points. Its been shot about 200 times with this set up and you can barely notice any damage.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice target.
customer_reviews.text: Good target but if you are any way unable to lift much or anything like that this may not be right for you as this is very heavy for its size. I understand it has to stop very fast moving arrows but I feel it necessary to mention.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not centered
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why but the images are smaller and every where on the bag but in the middle. The 9 ball is very small and all the way over to where the 1 ball is on the very edge of the bag. I bought this so my husband and I could have a little competition in the back yard when we have down time. You are still able to use it but it is poorly made in regards to the labels.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica K.

customer_reviews.title: Long lasting target!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using the Morrell target for indoor target practice for me and my son the past few months shooting our recurve bows (20lbs and 30lbs draw) and it's been holding up really well! The ability to shoot all sides of the cube makes it a great value for the price as it not only provides different targets to practice on but also extended longevity.
customer_reviews.author: HotPotJunkie

customer_reviews.title: This target does stop crossbow arrows
customer_reviews.text: Ok I ordered this because of the good reviews . When I open the box almost all the metal clips were out of place not holding the material together as you can see in the picture. So I decided to stitch it instead of sending it back as you can see in the other picture. After repairs it’s now in good shape. The targets performs very well, my crossbow arrows are easily removed. My suggestion to the manufacturer is to get rid of the metal clips and stitch the back of the target . I would of have given this target a 5 except the product clips were a failure
customer_reviews.author: Pappy

customer_reviews.title: Eats field tips.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: very portable, each face provides a different target experience, stops well Cons: eats arrows Using for around a week, primarily as a 3yard drill target, with less than 100 total arrows. I have lost 3 screw on field tips inside of this target and have broken 1 carbon VAP arrow tip off completely while trying to remove it (the other 2 tips I intentionally threaded off while they were still in the target once the arrow became irretrievable). Using an arrow lube doesn’t seem to be helping.
customer_reviews.author: APG SC1

customer_reviews.title: Good practice block, very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This is our second block by this brand. The last one was left behind in a hurricane when my husband was stationed in the South. The block survived and was still near the site we left it. But over time after the water damage it needed to be replaced. We use it for target practice weekly and it’s still in good shape after having it for 7 months.
customer_reviews.author: Cal River Farms

customer_reviews.title: Removing arrows from This target is an arm wrenching ordeal!
customer_reviews.text: This very heavy arrow target does stop arrows from my 400+ FPS crossbow however the materials used inside the target which appear to consist of long wraps of twine and plastic materials wrap around the points and fletching making it impossible to extract the arrows without damage! Pulling backwards results in lost tips and pulling forward destroys the fletching!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a great target bag for general archery
customer_reviews.text: This is a great target bag for general archery, but I have a few complaints about it. First, the bottom staples aren't in there all that well - I had two already pulling out when we took it out of the box, brand-new. I have no faith that this thing will last more than a few seasons, as we'll be dragging it around on camping trips, not just leaving it in the backyard. Second, although it's fun having the different target patterns on different sides, unless you shoot pygmy deer it's not exactly "real life size" practice...
customer_reviews.author: C. RobinsonTop Contributor: Archery

customer_reviews.title: Nice product.
customer_reviews.text: I have several targets but like this the best. Arrow removal is easy and doesn't require an arrow puller. Also, works well in below freezing weather. Arrow depth into the target is modest. Cover presents four different visual icons, one for each of its four sides, which varies what the shooter takes aim at---again, a nice feature. The outer yellow fabric is a little suspect by feel and is attached by some funky staples on the bottom, but pay no attention to this as it stands up to a pounding. Size and price is good.
customer_reviews.author: DrD

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as everyone says
customer_reviews.text: Shot about 75 arrows in it the first day I had it. At first I was very impressed with how easy the arrows were to remove but after about 40 or 50 I noticed the arrows were getting stuck and sometimes pulling whatever material is inside of the target out. This leads me to believe I probably should have went with a block target instead.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda S.

customer_reviews.title: Works well with high speed bolts
customer_reviews.text: I just bought a Killer Instinct Ripper 415 crossbow, and found that it went clear through my normal high density block target, destroying the fletching on the bolt. It fires a 450 grain bolt at 415 fps with over 150 ftlbs of force. The Morrell Double Duty worked well to stop it with about 2/3 shaft penetrating. It was also much easier to pull the bolt back out than on my other block target. I think it is a great bargain and certainly worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Fritz

customer_reviews.title: Kick Azz Crossbow Target Block !
customer_reviews.text: Best crossbow target block I have ever used . Great to sight-in or check your crossbow or plane enjoy taking a couple shots before heading out "in woods" ! I usually don't write reviews but this is a must for any crossbow user . I know my crossbows are "spot on" now , how about yours ? Great job Morrell !!!
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Ann

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Shooting at 420 FPS and even at 70 yards my bolts were buried.... ruined my bolts and you can not shoot with broad heads
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Withstands 415 FPS Arrows and lasts long
customer_reviews.text: I have a killer Instinct Bow shooting arrows at 400+ FPS and two things I love about it. 1) The target doesn’t budge on impact and the arrow stops quick. 2) I’ve put several arrows in it and most other targets would be severely worn out by now. Not this one. It has plenty of life left.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Martini

customer_reviews.title: Bag is well made and stops high speed crossbows
customer_reviews.text: Shooting my new Barnett TS390 crossbow at this bag at 20 yards and it simply does the job. The arrow penetrates with a loud thump at 20 yards at and shooting at 390fps but the bag stops it every time. The arrow pulls out effortlessly. The bag looks well made and only time will tell if it holds up like others say in their reviews.
customer_reviews.author: dewayne

customer_reviews.title: This is the best crossbow / archery target there is when it comes ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the best crossbow / archery target there is when it comes to stopping an arrow and then allowing easy removal. I don't know how they do it but it works. It's not the most convenient as it's fairly heavy but it holds up very well and it's easy arrow removal characteristics are unmatched by any target out there. Only other drawback is you can't use broadheads but I consider this minor since my crossbow doesn't require me to actually practice with broadheads. Plus I use mechanicals which come with dummy practice points anyhow. This is simply the best target you can get overall!
customer_reviews.author: Philip Scheiderich

customer_reviews.title: Love the variety of targets
customer_reviews.text: I got this today and the first three arrows pulled out easily. The next one didn't want to come out. So I jerked on it real hard and it came out with the black stuffing and made a big hole. I was able to get the stuffing back in, but it took about 10 minutes. Before that 4th arrow it would have been 5 stars, but I'm afraid it's not going to last as long as I'd hoped. The rest of the arrows pulled out easily. It was just that one time I had trouble getting an arrow out.
customer_reviews.author: H Trans Svcs

customer_reviews.title: What A Great Target
customer_reviews.text: This has got to be the best target out there. . It stops the arrows every time and still lets you take them out so easy. . And 4 sides gives you plenty of selection of targets to shoot. . And being square with a good weight to it, it'll never move when hit. . Excellent target!
customer_reviews.author: mark m.

customer_reviews.title: This heavy duty target has you covered.
customer_reviews.text: This is simply the best target you can get to stop fast cross bow arrows, even at only 10 yards penetration is about 10-11" and the arrows really do pull out easily. The 2 built in handles make this easy to move around. Even multiple arrows in the same hole still stop like they should. The multiple choices of different targets on each side tests your skills.Whether you shoot indoors like I do or at long range this heavy duty target has you covered.
customer_reviews.author: DanBoTop Contributor: Archery

customer_reviews.title: Crap
customer_reviews.text: Junk! this block claims to handle 450 fps.... I bought a crossbow and decided I would need this block to handle the 400 fps that my new bow shoots. At 40 yards my bolts were going completely through the block except the fletching, as a result I wrecked three bolts before throwing this block out!! JUNK!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great target
customer_reviews.text: Product is a bit bulky to carry, but it has to be to do it’s job. First day sighting in my son’s Bear Saga 370 we fired 40 bolts into the target with no issues of removing them or losing any tips. We did however make sure every tip was tight after we pulled them out. With a 370 fps crossbow the bolts were sinking a little less than half way up the bolt at 20 yards. 40 bolts barely did anything to the one side of the target we used. No issues what so ever with this product. So far a great purchase
customer_reviews.author: Doug McCall

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: My husband has found a new fave toy. Sturdy, durable, exactly what he wanted. He is using a Barnett Recruit Terrain crossbow and this target has really helped him w sighting it in. And he has customized and played around with adding his own targets over the existing. Happy Birthday you Daryl Dixon wannabe.
customer_reviews.author: LB+6

customer_reviews.title: The best target for crossbows
customer_reviews.text: Positive: extremely durable, well-crafted, high quality, big enough for 4 paper targets 6 X 6 " to be attached. Steady, practically unmoveable target for bolts up to 450 FPS - checked, proven to be true. So far, almost ideal target for 370-390 FPS crossbows. Shot it on 25, 30 and 40 Yards - impressive results. Negative: quite heavy (my wife was unable to manage it) and cumbersome. Aluminium bolts are relatively easy to remove; high-end carbon bolts (Headhunter, Decimator and such) - pretty manageable, cheaper ones - not always easy. Bottom line: excellent product . Strongly recommended for casual crossbow shooting, however, could be used for more serious training.
customer_reviews.author: Vitin  Alexander

customer_reviews.title: False Advertisement
customer_reviews.text: My bow shoots 405FPS. Less than 30 shots in and I have ruined the veins on 7 bolts. Im now $140 down due to the horrible false advertisement. Amazon needs to pull this sham off the shelf
customer_reviews.author: Jim Whittle

customer_reviews.title: Feild tip target
customer_reviews.text: The eas of pulling the arrows out, there are mixed reviews on this target not sure what others are doing but our xbow is a 200 lb draw weight shooting 415 fps and the target preforms as a target should, and this target isn't for broadheads some other revieweres were shooting them in this target not very intelligent .
customer_reviews.author: Jk

customer_reviews.title: If you own a crossbow, then you need this ...
customer_reviews.text: If you own a crossbow, then you need this target. I am disabled. The ease of removing your bolt is incredible. It takes no puller, just your hands. A child could pull the bolt out. My cross bow shoots up to 370 FPS. The bolts enter about 70% of the target at 20 yards.Incredible product.
customer_reviews.author: Carina

customer_reviews.title: struggling to get my arrows out
customer_reviews.text: At 70lbs I've been struggling to get my arrows out. I think this is the same for all bag targets. The arrows bind on the inner 'stuffing' at the tip and often have to be cut out. Fine for my 40lbs recurve. Lots of stuff to shoot at on the different sides of the target.
customer_reviews.author: David H.

customer_reviews.title: Stops my crossbow bolts & easy to pull out them out
customer_reviews.text: Stops my crossbow nicely and bolts are easy to pull out. It is much heavier than it looks. I would recommend. Only complaint is the seams on the bottom of the target are stapled and I have my doubts about how it will hold up, but I am storing it in doors so it will hopefully be fine (staples onthe bottom is why I gave 4 not 5 stars).
customer_reviews.author: Stephen P.

customer_reviews.title: Works fantastic for Recurve shooting
customer_reviews.text: Great Product so far! Its heavy but still one arm portable, two finger arrow removal is true 90 percent of the time. Multiple targets are great and the fact they sell new covers means for my recurve a target forever. My only gripe is the horrendus shrieking sound it makes when I pull arrows. FAST SHIPPING even to bum frick Alaska!
customer_reviews.author: kraig holdren

customer_reviews.title: VERY easy arrow removal
customer_reviews.text: VERY easy arrow removal. Sometimes they are slightly more difficult than other times, but I would say the marketing description of "2 finger arrow removal" is not an exaggeration. In fact, if my grouping is good sometimes I will pull 4 arrow or so out at once without even stabilizing the target with my other hand. Stops arrows with roughly 1/3-1/2 arrow penetration with field tips. Estimate my arrows travel about 300 fps (bow rated at 335 at max setup.) Seems to be holding up well have a few hundred shots. Time will tell it lasts the 1+ years advertised.
customer_reviews.author: acray

customer_reviews.title: 400 Feet Per Second Target
customer_reviews.text: It's a little heavy, but it stops the bolts from my 360 crossbow. Bolts go in about 10" and are easily taken out. Like they all say, with 2 fingers. I shoot it from 10 yards to 60 yards without any trouble. I've shot it about 60 times on one side and seams to be holding up really well. Great target.
customer_reviews.author: Russ

customer_reviews.title: Moore loops
customer_reviews.text: I would love to help give it a five star if only there have been four straps instead of two at an angle which makes it not possible to hang and game at a target Square. It stops and arrow perfectly and releases an arrow fantastically.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Boghokian

customer_reviews.title: Easy to pull out your arrows
customer_reviews.text: Good, portable, self healing target. Easy to set up, just put it on the ground! Easy to pull arrows out. Tough. Only criticism is that they should have a regular target graphic on one side.
customer_reviews.author: GaiasJewels

customer_reviews.title: Good quality Target for high powered xbows etc
customer_reviews.text: Very nice Target. Stopped my ghost 420 bolts at 10 yards without hitting fletching. Very nice Target. Takes a lot to stop the arrows from my Barnette Ghost up close but this does the job. Recommended
customer_reviews.author: Austin

customer_reviews.title: Has been the only target I've needed for going on two years now.
customer_reviews.text: Works great for my crossbow with field tips at 350fps. Bolts pull out easily with one hand. I don't recommend shooting broadheads into it as they have to be cut out, tearing up your nice target.
customer_reviews.author: Tanner

customer_reviews.title: BINGO!!!
customer_reviews.text: This was bought for use with my Bear Cruzer compound bow. I shoot from 20-50 yards away, and my arrows can easily be extracted with this target! Love the variety in graphics, especially the billiard balls and dart board. Relatively lightweight, and decent construction, except for the bottom of the unit which is supported by staples. But if that becomes an issue, an epoxy will be a good choice for repair. No more fighting to extract arrows--which makes my sessions longer, less tiring, and more fun.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Fella

customer_reviews.title: Good target.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this with my first bow for field tips. Shooting at 15 yards @ 65 pound draw, this target only allows the arrow to enter about 5 inches. The arrows pull out very easily as well. It is made of a tarp like material, so I will be dragging this into the shed to avoid it deteriorating in the sun/rain/snow. It's fairly heavy, enough so that I know it isn't going to move or blow away. The straps seems sturdy, and the prints on each side are clear and colorful. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Cody

customer_reviews.title: very happy
customer_reviews.text: First target I have bought and very happy with it. I didn't like the color of it online but once I started using it really like the yellow and multiple sides. The targets will definitely wear out but I plan to paint a side or two and do my own with some spray paint so no big deal.
customer_reviews.author: mike wagner

customer_reviews.title: Stops 410 fps crossbow bolts dead ... Very easy arrow removal.
customer_reviews.text: I went through several targets until settling for this one ... outstanding for field points but SOL on broadheads. Still they made that very clear. Still need a 450 fps broad-head target. This one is a keeper for field point onlys. Really easy arrow removal with Gold Tip easy out field tips.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay M.

customer_reviews.title: Stops the arrows
customer_reviews.text: Good wear if you rotate every half dozen shots. Lots of 'side bullseyes' like the Morrell logo with bullseye print for the 'O' that will increase wear life. Next one i get need to be 450FPS rated for broadhead practice.
customer_reviews.author: itchy aids

customer_reviews.title: No tug-of-war required
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product! It has held up well so far. It has a good weight to it, so it doesn't move when using it, arrows come out without a tug-of-war contest (my bow is set at 70 pounds), and you have a variety of targets on the cube.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle H

customer_reviews.title: A Great product I love it !!!
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t think it was going to work at first but it’s working Great I’m really pleased with it Will recommend to anyone that shoots a crossbow that shoots around 400fps
customer_reviews.author: Bobby Toler

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: It's fairly heavy, which is nice so it doesn't fall over whenever you shoot it. Easy to pull my crossbow bolts out (400 fps at 20 yards). I would recommend this to a friend
customer_reviews.author: Collision

customer_reviews.title: Stops bolts and 2 finger removal.
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 other targets. None can beat this one. Stops bolts and very easy bolt or arrow removal. Best I have purchased and I have 4 others in my garage.
customer_reviews.author: SCI1994/8

customer_reviews.title: Great Target , As Advertized.
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised , great target. Mind you , read the weight ... this thing is heavy. My 45lbs shooting broad heads only penetrate a few inches into the target. Sometimes I can still see the back of the broadheads
customer_reviews.author: Logan Ferromann

customer_reviews.title: Best bag to shoot
customer_reviews.text: This is the best bag to practice on. 4-sided, easy to remove field points, and I shot the hell out of my first one. Will easily last you several years if you take basic care of it.
customer_reviews.author: rusk31

customer_reviews.title: This target is excellent. I stops the fastest crossbow bolts (I have ...
customer_reviews.text: This target is excellent. I stops the fastest crossbow bolts (I have a Barnett Ghost 415) and you really can pull them out with only two fingers. The filler material is similar to a mesh netting. If you shoot it with only field points, it will last a VERY long time. If you're using practice broad heads, be careful there are no protrusions that will pull the mesh filling out of the hole.
customer_reviews.author: Michael B

customer_reviews.title: Durable target takes what you can hit it with
customer_reviews.text: I use this target with both a compound bow (arrows @ ~250 FPS) and a crossbow (bolts @ ~340 FPS). Target handles both without problems - very durable target. Size presents a decent enough target at 20 yards; it may seem small at that distance for an inexperienced archer, but if you are a bowhunter, it's about the size of the zone you're going to need to target in the field. Arrows and bolts pull out without difficulty (I've used this target with field points, but not broadheads.) Overall very pleased with this target.
customer_reviews.author: Captain Silver

customer_reviews.title: excellent target for the price
customer_reviews.text: Very nice target. Not heavy, so its easy to move with the attached handle straps. Has four shootable target faces so it will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Has held up very well to my frequent use of it as a high power crossbow target. My crossbow shoots around 375fps and even with my arthritic hands I can still get the arrows out of target easily.
customer_reviews.author: LIVIT

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: Great at first... it sat covered in my shed for one summer then just pulled it out for sighting in my bow and the arrows went right through it. Garbage. And I wrote morrell to tell them and they never even replied.
customer_reviews.author: BJ Fischer

customer_reviews.title: Does a good job stopping arrows
customer_reviews.text: Does a good job stopping arrows. Definitely shows wear very quickly. Tarp bag material has large holes after 200 arrows shot into it. Paint was very light and it could be re-painted already. Better than cheap cabelas foam block target.
customer_reviews.author: tmbirdsall

customer_reviews.title: Good value and quality
customer_reviews.text: Heavy built for the price and stops my bolts that shoot around 360fps. Bolts are also very very easy to remove. The bag is heavy and a good size for home use. Multiple targets make it fun to use. You can pay more and get the same arrow stoping but this will do what you need. Arrived quickly as well.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Duncan

customer_reviews.title: Really easy to remove!
customer_reviews.text: Love this target. I shoot with a 55# traditional recurve and this target does well in stopping my arrows. They're also extremely easy to remove compared to my old foam target. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Chen

customer_reviews.title: Awesome target!
customer_reviews.text: I'm new to the hobby. I recently purchased a Samick sage recurve. I came across this target and liked that it had 4 different faces. This is fun because you can attempt to place darts or flip it to a different face for standard target shooting. My only complaint is that I wish it were a little wider.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: If time practicing is important this is the target to get
customer_reviews.text: Excellent archery target, this thing makes shoot arrows much more enjoyable. Arrow removal isn't an issue with the target, a 3 year old can easily pull them out. Not much chance of over penatration with this target either. I've yet to have an arrow go past 14 inch and that is with hundreds of shots on the same side.
customer_reviews.author: BrutalTim

customer_reviews.title: exactly what I was hoping for
customer_reviews.text: sturdy and bolts from my Ravin R-26 are easily removed with very little energy. Only drawback is that it is pretty heavy and difficult to maneuver despite the handles.
customer_reviews.author: njelkman

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: This thing works great. I'm shooting at 415 fps and while the bolts go in pretty far, they rarely go all the way up to the fletching. Also, they pull out super easy.
customer_reviews.author: Lloyd Williams

customer_reviews.title: Arrows with field tips pull out easy!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to carry and large enough to see well at 40-50 Yards when shooting my Crossbow, Arrows pull out very easy and this bag stops them very well!! Wish it could handle broad heads but not designed for that. Trust me do not try. :)
customer_reviews.author: Bev & Rob

customer_reviews.title: Great Value with very good stopping power. For crossbows too!
customer_reviews.text: We have been shooting quite a few arrows into this target, and it stops 'em all with ease. Removal is easy too. The 4 sides have different pictures to shoot at which is nice depending on your next outing. e.g.-Hunting vs Target practice. It is remarkably heavy which is a good thing as it easily stops my sons 65 lb easton aluminum arrows. I just shot my Excalibur 200 lb crossbow and it stopped my 20" aluminum bolt (point blank-field tip) with only 9" of penetration into the target. So I would highly recommend this target for all your archery target needs.
customer_reviews.author: Peach32

customer_reviews.title: Horrible material inside makes arrow removal difficult
customer_reviews.text: I lost 2 inserts and 2 field tips in this bag after only 14 shots. The material inside wrapped around the arrow and never released the insert where it connects to the shaft. I'm not sure why some people have issues and others do not. I was shooting a compound bow at 275fps with Gold Tip Hunter XT 340 arrows with a 100gr tip if that helps.
customer_reviews.author: K. Jones

customer_reviews.title: LIghtweight durable target
customer_reviews.text: Ive been using this target pretty heavy for the last couple weeks. Arrows pull out extremely easy and only about 6-10" of my arrow shaft sticks in. I shoot about 280FPS with my compound. Not only is it durable, but lightweight. Other targets I have owned dang near takes two people to move, this one is light enough a child could haul it around.
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: Very Good crossbow target
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid target that takes bolts with ease and also gives them up with relative ease. so far it has only kept one target point after 100+- shots. I like it and the price isn't bad.
customer_reviews.author: Tom I

customer_reviews.title: Makes Removing Target Arrows So Easy
customer_reviews.text: It's a bit on the heavy side, but the tradeoff is so worth it. Removing practice arrows is smooth and effortless, yet they only enter about 30% of the length of the arrow. The weight/shape make it impossible to blow/knock over. It's durable and I like the different target patterns on all sides.
customer_reviews.author: Brian G.

customer_reviews.title: Simply outstanding
customer_reviews.text: Put it in a tight spot only 9 yards from my bow and boy does this baby stop arrows. Best part is removal is much easier than the block-type targets. I'm not shooting a crossbow but it's stopping my fast PSE bow just fine. Let's see how it holds up over time.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Russo

customer_reviews.title: Awesome target!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome and for the price it is great. Make sure your field tips are the same diameter at your arrow because if they are wider you won't be able to pull the arrow out of target. And this is not a target for broadheads. I really love this target
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: good target, but not better than Morrell Double Duty 400 FPS
customer_reviews.text: good target, but not better than Morrell Double Duty 400 FPS. It will not stop any arrow with the speed more than 400 FPS from 20 yards distance.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Stops arrows
customer_reviews.text: Been shooting at this for a few months now a couple days a week. It’s holding up and I haven’t had an arrow go through it yet.
customer_reviews.author: THe Wizard

customer_reviews.title: ... with field points and allows them to be removed easily. Just wish it would work for testing broadheads
customer_reviews.text: Definitely stops crossbow bolts with field points and allows them to be removed easily. Just wish it would work for testing broadheads. Also If you shoot a lot I don't see how the fabric will hold up. However this is a lower end price for target blocks. That said it works as advertised. I'm guessing a few hundred shots per side? I guess you could replace or recover the shot up fabric if it gets really bad. I would buy it again because of the pricing.
customer_reviews.author: John T. Turner

customer_reviews.title: Update your product pictures
customer_reviews.text: Not what the picture looked like I didn't get a side with deer antlers or pool balls . Just a yellow jacket logo on 2 of the sides. Kinda disappointed was looking forward to getting what I paid for. With 2 of the sides gone is not worth 70 bucks.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Berry

customer_reviews.title: Awesome target. Great price.
customer_reviews.text: Using this for a 370 FPS crossbow. Awesome target with great stopping power and easy bolt extraction. Great value and price.
customer_reviews.author: Shane & Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Not durable
customer_reviews.text: The arrows go right through this product, and rip a large hole each time. It is impossible to get the arrows out.
customer_reviews.author: Debra

customer_reviews.title: Solid Target that works well
customer_reviews.text: Can't speak for others, but this target with my high FPS crossbow works well. Have shot many bolts at it and have had no issues. Would purchase another if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Retarted Retiree

customer_reviews.title: Compound Bow is 390 FPS
customer_reviews.text: This target keeps taking the pounding!!! It is fun for target games....and great for readying the deer killer within!
customer_reviews.author: Donald

customer_reviews.title: Nice Target
customer_reviews.text: It's a Morrell - what more needs to be said. It's somewhat heavy - but yet it has to be to hold up Use with a TenPoint stealth XLT - 320 fps - pic is first 4 shots with new crossbow at 20 yards New target for me - so I can't review it's durability. but I will.....
customer_reviews.author: NC10735285

customer_reviews.title: Great bolt stopper
customer_reviews.text: I got this to use with my Bear crossbow that's rated at 405 fps. This is great for my bow since the bolts only penetrate about 50 percent of the way making them easy to pull out and the feathers don't get damaged. I expect this will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy Boy

customer_reviews.title: Very good target
customer_reviews.text: This is a great target and handles high velocity. I have a Ghost420 and the bolts come out no problem and stop before the fetching. Great product! I have even put bolts into it from 40ft and still stops them no problem.
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Awesome target. Works exactly as advertised. Stops all my 440 grain arrows with fieldpoints shot using crossbow with 380 fps velocity from 30 yards effectively without destroying my arrow fletchings. Arrows easily removes from target using only two fingers.
customer_reviews.author: Kickinback

customer_reviews.title: Bad fill material
customer_reviews.text: This target stops arrows fine but the fill is like a Chinese finger trap and when you pull the arrows it wont let go I've lost 3 incerts
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome target!
customer_reviews.text: Love this target. It is the second one i have owned...Harvey washed away the first one. If something happens to this one, i will definitely buy another....it holds up to my crossbow bolts over and over...
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Target for Archery, Great Product !!!
customer_reviews.text: Just started archery and was looking for a target to practice at home since each trip to my local shooting range was about $14 and that too just for an hour, so decided to invest in a target. Using this target at 10 yd range in my basement and its working excellent. I love this target and now I can practice for as long as I want and whenever I want so even though its a bit costly but I think it pays for itself in less than a week and looking at its build quality I think it will run for years. Great Product !!!
customer_reviews.author: Jitendra R.

product_meta.title: Morrell Double Duty 450FPS Field Point Bag Archery Target - for Crossbows, Compounds, Traditional Bows and Airbows
product_meta.description: Morrell Double Duty 450 FPS Field Point Bag Archery Target gives you capability of a shooting target to withstand abuse of Crossbows, Compound Bows and Air bows with super easy arrow removal. This target can withstand thousands of shots from these bows. These bag targets are so tough they can even stop 440 FPS from an Air bow. THAT’S THE FASTEST KNOWN ARROW FLIGHT! The target cover is completely replaceable to increase core target life even longer. This is truly an archery target that can last for years and years. With today's fast crossbows and compound bows an archer needs the advantage of having an extremely durable archery bag target which this Double Duty doesn't fall short of by a LONG shot. The easy tote carrying handles provide easy transportation and portability. A archery target stand is not necessary because this block target is a free-standing archery target being a cube it is locked into the ground like a vault. The graphics gives this target easy visibility for target practice. This bow and arrow target is used for the serious archer who plans to fling thousands of arrows!

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
